This file will become your README and also the index of your
documentation.

## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install nbdev_hello in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure nbdev_hello package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to nbdev_hello
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/s66erge/nbdev-hello):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/s66erge/nbdev-hello.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/s66erge/nbdev-hello)

``` sh
$ conda install -c s66erge nbdev_hello
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/nbdev-hello/)

``` sh
$ pip install nbdev_hello
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/s66erge/nbdev-hello)’s
[pages](https://s66erge.github.io/nbdev-hello/). Additionally you can
find package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/s66erge/nbdev-hello) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/nbdev-hello/) respectively.
